table.insight: Vendor and Customer Names are same & not disclosed
table.description: Balances may be misstated if receivables and payables between the same party are not reconciled or offset properly.

table.insight: Invoice Date Prior to PO Date
table.description: Liability may be recorded before proper authorization or supporting PO documentation. Payments could be made for unapproved or premature purchases.
Multiple smaller invoices or POs may obscure total vendor exposure.

table.insight: Delay in payment to MSME Vendor
table.description: Overdue MSME balances may not reflect accrued interest or disclosure requirements
Payments may be made against invalid or disputed invoices, distorting liability balances. Payments to blocked vendors could result in unrecoverable funds.

table.insight: Some Expenses for PO and Non PO transaction
table.description: Non-PO transactions may not be properly matched to valid POs, leading to reconciliation issues. Payments may be made without adequate documentation or approval.

table.insight: Deviation in liability compares to base rate and quantity
table.description: Incorrect liability recognition due to deviation from contractual base rate. Material receipts valued incorrectly if based on wrong rate or quantity.

table.insight: Payment Beyond 60/180 Days since Due Date
table.description: Delayed payments lead to prolonged outstanding payables on the balance sheet, which may inflate current liabilities and distort liquidity ratios. Holding cash longer may temporarily overstate cash balances compared to actual operational liabilities.

table.insight: Repeated Vendor Invoice in the Same Fiscal Year
table.description: Duplicate vendor invoices recorded in the same fiscal year inflate the accounts payable balance, leading to an overstatement of liabilities. Overstated expenses reduce net income, thereby reducing retained earnings in the balance sheet.
Conflict of interest between employees and vendors may result in inflated expenses or fraudulent payments.
Payments to employees acting as vendors could lead to duplicate or fraudulent expense recognition.
Segregation of duty conflict risks fraudulent purchases or false inventory valuation.

table.insight: Creation of GRN and Payment by Same User
table.description: Fraud risk due to lack of control; could result in unauthorized payments and misstated liabilities.
